post_message: Calling the practice of intercepting cellphone information secretive and widespread, a federal lawsuit alleges Chicago has an "arsenal" of cell site simulators (or "Stingrays"). When deployed by police, these devices capture data from any phone in its range — not just the intended target.  "Government spying on its citizens without appropriate judicial oversight is inconsistent with the freedoms guaranteed by the Constitution," said Jerry Boyle, a Chicago attorney who brought the case.
